SCURTĂ DESCRIERE* BRIEF DESCRIPTION* * COROBORAREA CONğINUTURILOR DISCIPLINEI CU AŞTEPTĂRILE REPREZENTANğILOR COMUNITĂğII EPISTEMICE, ASOCIAğIILOR PROFESIONALE ŞI ANGAJATORI REPREZENTATIVI DIN DOMENIUL AFERENT PROGRAMULUI / CORRELATION BETWEEN THE CONTENT OF THE COURSE AND THE NEEDS/EXPECTATIONS OF THE EPISTEMIC COMMUNITY, PROFESSIONAL ASSOCIATION S AND/OR SIGNIFICANT EMPLOYERS RELEVANT FOR THE PROGRAM No܊iunile introduse în acest curs vor dezvolta capacitatea de analiză ܈i de sinteză a studen܊ilor, contribuind astfel la formarea abilită܊ilor de cercetare ܈i inovare ale acestora. Programarea probabilistă s-a bucurat în ultimii ani de un interes crescut în domeniul inteligenĠei artificiale. Obiectivele cursului sunt acelea de înĠelegere a conceptelor şi mecanismelor de bază ale programării probabiliste ܈i utilizarea acestora pentru construcĠia de modele probabiliste, pregătind astfel cursanĠii pentru piaĠa muncii. Oferind deasemenea acces la dezvoltări ܈i tendinĠe actuale – teoretice ܈i practice – cursul pregăte܈te candida܊i care pot urma programe doctorale ܈i care pot deveni membri ai departamentelor de cercetare ale firmelor din domeniu. The concepts brought in by this course will develop student capabilities of analysis and synthesis, thus contributing to the formation of their research and innovation abilities. Probabilistic programming has seen growing interest within Artificial Intelligence over the last years. The course objectives are the understanding of the basic concepts and

--- Pagina 17 ---
29 mechanisms of the probabilistic programming and using probabilistic programming for building a probabilistic model of a phenomenon, thus preparing the students for the labor market. The course also gives access to current trends in the field, of both theoretical and practical nature. It prepares students for future doctoral programs, but also for becoming members of the research departments of companies in the field. 10. COMPETENğE SPECIFICE ACUMULATE ACQUIRED SKILLS 6.1 CompetenĠe profesionale Professional skills • Capacitatea de a utiliza cȃteva limbaje formale de reprezentare a cunoştinĠelor ܈i de a dezvolta proceduri de inferenĠă care să fie effective în diferite situaĠii • Ability of using some formal knowledge representation languages and developing reasoning procedures that are effective for various tasks • Capacitatea de a proiecta sisteme de inferenĠă care să Ġină cont de constrȃngerile de timp ܈i resurse dictate de o aplicaĠie • Ability of building reasoning systems that operate within the time and resource constraints of the applications that need them 6.2 CompetenĠe transversale Cross-cutting skills • Dezvoltarea gândirii critice; dezvoltarea capacităĠii de a citi, înĠelege ܈i prelucra materialele literaturii de specialitate. • Development of critical thinking; development of the capacity to read, understand and process the information in the literature of the field. • Stimularea gândirii analitice ܈i sintetice; formarea abilităĠilor de cercetător. • Stimulation of analytic and synthetic thinking; formation of research abilities. • Constituirea echipei de cercetare; organizarea activităĠilor de cercetare/proiectare în proiecte realizate în echipă. Desfăşurarea eficientă ܈i eficace a activităĠilor organizate în echipă. • Building the research team; organizing research/development activities within team projects. Efficient and efficacious progress of group research/development activities. • Capacitatea de a redacta si prezenta referate ܈i proiecte. • Developing the capacity to write and to present papers and projects. • Documentarea judicioasă pentru abordarea unor teme ܈i probleme concrete. • Judiciously acquiring the necessary documentation for approaching specific topics and problems. • Manifestarea unor atitudini responsabile faĠă de domeniul ştiinĠific, pentru valorificarea optimă şi creativă a propriului potenĠial în cercetare, cu respectarea principiilor şi a normelor de etică a cercetării şi de etică profesională, in general. • Having a responsible attitude towards the scientific domain, for the creative and optimal exploitation of one’s own research potential, while following all principles and norms of research ethics and of professional ethics, in general. 7. OBIECTIVELE DISCIPLINEI COURSE GOAL & OBJECTIVES

--- Pagina 21 ---
33 7.1 Obiectivul general al disciplinei Course goal • Familiarizarea cu domeniul reprezentării cunoştinĠelor şi inferenĠei, un subdomeniu al inteligenĠei artificiale care priveşte modul în care cunoştinĠele pot fi reprezentate simbolic şi manipulate automat de programe capabile de inferenĠă • Getting acquainted with the field of knowledge representation and reasoning, the area of Artificial Intelligence concerned with how knowledge can be represented symbolically and manipulated in an automated way by reasoning programs 7.2 Obiective specifice Course objectives • ȊnĠelegerea conceptelor şi mecanismelor de bază ale reprezentării cunoştinĠelor şi inferenĠei, în special a interdependenĠei dintre reprezentare şi inferenĠă • Understanding of the basic concepts and mechanisms of the knowledge representation and reasoning, especially the interplay between representation and reasoning • ȊnĠelegerea modului în care pot fi reprezentate cunoştinĠele cȃt mai comprehensiv posibil, permiĠȃnd totodată un raĠionamet efectiv asupra lor • Understanding how knowledge can at the same time be represented as comprehensively as possible and be reasoned with as effectively as possible 8. Curs Course Metode de predare Teaching methods ObservaĠii Remarks Conceptele de bază: cunoştinĠe, reprezentare şi inferenĠă The Key Concepts: Knowledge, Representation, and Reasoning Prezentarea bazată pe slide-uri Explica܊ia Descrierea ܈i exemplificarea Presentation based on slides Explanation Description and exemplification Ingineria cunoştinĠelor bazată pe logica de ordinul întâi Knowledge Engineering Based on the First-Order Logic Sisteme de producîie şi reguli Production Systems and Rules Reprezentarea orientată pe obiecte: cadre Object-Oriented Representation: Frames ReĠele semantice şi ontologii Semantic networks and Ontologies InferenĠa bazată pe informaĠie implicită Reasoning with Default Information CunoştinĠe incerte şi inferenĠă: ReĠele Bayesiene Uncertain Knowledge and Reasoning: Bayesian Networks Bibliografie/ Bibliography: Stuart Russell, Peter Norvig, Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach, Third Edition, Prentice Hall, 2010. SCURTĂ DESCRIERE* BRIEF DESCRIPTION* * COROBORAREA CONğINUTURILOR DISCIPLINEI CU AŞTEPTĂRILE REPREZENTANğILOR COMUNITĂğII EPISTEMICE, ASOCIAğIILOR PROFESIONALE ŞI ANGAJATORI REPREZENTATIVI DIN DOMENIUL AFERENT PROGRAMULUI / CORRELATION BETWEEN THE CONTENT OF THE COURSE AND THE NEEDS/EXPECTATIONS OF THE EPISTEMIC COMMUNITY, PROFESSIONAL ASSOCIATION S AND/OR SIGNIFICANT EMPLOYERS RELEVANT FOR THE PROGRAM No܊iunile introduse în acest curs vor dezvolta capacitatea de analiză ܈i de sinteză a studen܊ilor, contribuind astfel la formarea abilită܊ilor de cercetare ܈i inovare ale acestora. Ele vor conduce la o mai bună ܈i profundă în܊elegere a problemelor legate de Reprezentarea cunoştinĠelor şi inferenĠă, dezvoltând capacitatea de a concepe ܈i implementa sisteme de inferenĠă care să fie effective în diferite situaĠii, pregătind astfel cursanĠii pentru piaĠa muncii. Oferind deasemenea acces la dezvoltări ܈i tendinĠe actuale – teoretice ܈i practice – cursul pregăte܈te candida܊i care pot urma programe doctorale ܈i care pot deveni membri ai departamentelor de cercetare ale firmelor din domeniu. The concepts brought in by this course will develop student capabilities of analysis and synthesis, thus contributing to the formation of their research and innovation abilities. They will lead to a better and more profound understanding of knowledge representation and reasoning issues, while developing the capacity to conceive and to implement reasoning systems that are effective for various tasks, thus preparing the students for the labor market. The course also gives access to current trends in the field, of both theoretical and practical nature. It prepares students for future doctoral programs, but also for becoming members of the research departments of companies in the field. 10. OBIECTIVELE DISCIPLINEI COURSE GOAL & OBJECTIVES 7.1 Obiectivul general al disciplinei Course goal În cadrul acestei discipline studen܊ii vor putea opta între dezvoltarea unei aplica܊ii practice ܈i realizarea unei cercetări teoretice. Obiectivul disciplinei este de a dezvolta capacitatea de muncă independentă, capacitatea de comunicare a rezultateor ob܊inute, de analizare a metodelor ܈i instrumentelor specifice, de orientare în vederea dezvoltării profesionale ulterioare. Within this discipline, students will be able to choose between developing a practical application and conducting a theoretical research. The objective of the discipline is to develop independent work capacity, the ability to communicate the obtained results, to analyze the specific methods and instruments, and to guide them for further professional development. 7.2 Obiective specifice Course objectives Studen܊ii cu aptitudini aplicative vor realiza un proiect, individual sau în echipă. Studen܊ii cu aptitudini teoretice vor citi ܈i prezenta articole de cercetare ܈i vor realiza un raport ܈tiin܊ific. Students with applied skills will develop a project, individually or in a team. Students with theoretical skills will read and present research articles and will produce a scientific report.

43 • Building the research team; organizing research/development activities within team projects. OBIECTIVELE DISCIPLINEI COURSE GOAL & OBJECTIVES 7.1 Obiectivul general al disciplinei Course goal • Furnizarea intui܊iei din spatele metodelor de învă܊are automată precum ܈i a unui suport teoretic formalizat pentru a în܊elege cum, de ce ܈i când aceste metode func܊ionează. • Providing the intuition behind various machine learning methods as well as a bit more formal understanding of how, why and when they work 7.2 Obiective specifice Course objectives • Aprofundarea teoretică a diverselor metode de învă܊are automată. • Dezvoltarea din punct de vedere teoretic ܈i practic a capacită܊ii de alegere ܈i utilizare corectă a metodelor de învă܊are în diferite probleme reale. • Theoretical deepening of the various machine learning methods • Developing from both theoretical and practical point of view of the capacity to make informed choices about the machine learning methods to be used in various real problems 8. CONğINUTURI CONTENT 8.1. Curs Course Metode de predare Teaching methods ObservaĠii Remarks 1. Introducere – formalizarea problemelor din domeniul Învă܊ării Automate: privire de ansamblu, învă܊are supervizată (clasificare, regresie), învă܊area nesupervizată, învă܊are semi-supervizată, învă܊are ranforsată , alte scenarii. Introduction – formalizing Machine Learning problems: overview, supervised learning (classification, regression) unsupervised learning, semi-supervised learning, reinforcement learning, other scenarios. Metode de învă܊are supervizată Supervised learning methods 2. Dimensiunea Vapnik-Chernovenkis (VC). Supervised Learning Background Vapnik-Chervonenkis (VC) Dimension. PAC learning. 3. Regresia logistică. Perceptronul. Distribu܊ii de probabilitate exponen܊iale. Logistic regression. Perceptron. Exponential family. 4. Algoritmi de învă܊are generativi. Analiza discriminantă Gaussiană. Metoda naïve Bayes. Generative learning algorithms. Gaussian discriminant analysis. Naive Bayes. 5. Boosting. Boosting. 6. Optimizare convexă Convex optimization. 7. Ma܈ini cu vectori suport. Support vector machines. 8. Compromisul deplasare/varian܊ă. Bias/variance tradeoff. 9. Selec܊ia modelului ܈i a caracteristicilor. Model selection and feature selection. 10. 45 REPREZENTATIVI DIN DOMENIUL AFERENT PROGRAMULUI / CORRELATION BETWEEN THE CONTENT OF THE COURSE AND THE NEEDS/EXPECTATIONS OF THE EPISTEMIC COMMUNITY, PROFESSIONAL ASSOCIATION S AND/OR SIGNIFICANT EMPLOYERS RELEVANT FOR THE PROGRAM No܊iunile prezentate în acest curs dezvoltă capacitatea de analiză a problemelor de învă܊are automată ܈i de aplicare a celor mai potrivite metode pentru rezolvarea acestor probleme. Cursul este în principal axat pe în܊elegerea no܊iunilor teoretice ܈i a intui܊iei ce stau în spatele diverselor metode de învă܊ăre automată. Cursul î܈i propune să dezvolte ܈i aptitudini de cercetare ܈i inovare, pregătind candida܊ii atât în vederea continuării studiilor cu un program doctoral cât ܈i în vederea angajării ca membri în departamentele de cercetare ale companiilor din domeniul informaticii. The concepts presented in this course are aimed at developing both the capacity to analyze machine learning problems from the right perspective and the ability to choose the suitable method to solve these problems. The course is mainly focused on understanding the theoretical concepts and the intuition behind the various methods in machine learning. The course aims to develop the research and innovation abilities of the students, preparing them for both academia (they can pursue a doctoral program in the field) and industry (they can find employment in the R&D departments of computer science companies). 10. COMPETENğE SPECIFICE ACUMULATE ACQUIRED SKILLS 6.1 CompetenĠe profesionale Professional skills • Capacitatea de a utiliza instrumentele de procesare specifice ale domeniului; • Capacitatea de a analiza automat limbajul natural la nivel morfologic (POS-tagging), sintactic (analiza sintactică de dependenĠă) ܈i semantic (dezambiguizare automata a sensului – locală ܈i globală); • Familiarizare cu problema complexă a detectării automate a metaforei (atât prin abordări bazate pe cuno܈tinĠe, cât ܈i prin abordări statistice). • The capacity to use the typical processing tools of the field; • The capacity to automatically process natural language at morphological level (POS-tagging), syntactic level (dependency parsing) and semantic level (word sense disambiguation – local and global) • Becoming familiar with the complex problem of automatic metaphor detection (through both knowledge-based approaches and statistical approaches). 6.2 CompetenĠe transversale Cross-cutting skills • Dezvoltarea gândirii critice; dezvoltarea capacităĠii de a citi, înĠelege ܈i prelucra materialele literaturii de specialitate, atât în limba română, cât ܈i în limba engleză. • Stimularea gândirii analitice ܈i sintetice; formarea abilităĠilor de cercetător. • Documentarea judicioasă pentru abordarea unor teme ܈i probleme concrete. • Capacitatea de a identifica, în܊elege, aplica ܈i dezvolta materiale corespunzătoare bibliografiei cursului, pentru referate ܈i proiecte. • Capacitatea de a redacta si prezenta referate ܈i proiecte. • Constituirea echipei de cercetare; organizarea activităĠilor de cercetare/proiectare în proiecte realizate în echipă. Desfăşurarea eficientă ܈i eficace a activităĠilor organizate în echipă. • Manifestarea unor atitudini responsabile faĠă de domeniul ştiinĠific, pentru valorificarea optimă şi creativă a propriului potenĠial în cercetare, cu respectarea principiilor şi a normelor de etică a cercetării şi de etică profesională, in general. • Development of critical thinking; development of the capacity to read,

--- Pagina 43 ---
55 understand and process the information in the literature of the field, both in Romanian and in English. • Stimulation of analytic and synthetic thinking; formation of research abilities. • Judiciously acquiring the necessary documentation for approaching specific topics and problems. • Developing the capacity to identify, understand, apply and develop the appropriate course references for usage within papers and projects. • Developing the capacity to write and to present papers and projects. • Building the research team; organizing research/development activities within team projects. Efficient and efficacious progress of group research/development activities. • Having a responsible attitude towards the scientific domain, for the creative and optimal exploitation of one’s own research potential, while following all principles and norms of research ethics and of professional ethics, in general. 7. OBIECTIVELE DISCIPLINEI COURSE GOAL & OBJECTIVES 7.1 Obiectivul general al disciplinei Course goal • Familiarizarea cu un nou domeniu de studiu (cu ce se ocupă domeniul; tipuri de aplicaĠii; nivelurile la care se realizează prelucrarea automată a limbajului natural; dificultăĠi specifice prelucrării limbajului natural); • Familiarizarea cu instrumentele (de prelucrare) de bază, consacrate ale domeniului; • Utilizarea instrumentelor de bază ale domeniului în prelucrarea la nivel semantic a limbajului natural • Getting acquainted with a new field of study (what the field is about; types of applications; the levels of natural language processing; difficulties typical of natural language processing); • Getting acquainted with the basic processing tools of the field; • Using the basic processing tools of the field at the semantic level of natural language processing 7.2 Obiective specifice Course objectives • Folosirea instrumentelor de procesare tipice domeniului la nivelul semantic al prelucrării limbajului; • Problema dezambiguizării automate a sensului (dezambiguizare locala, dezambiguizare globala); • Problema detectării automate a metaforei • Using the typical processing tools of the field at the semantic level of natural language processing; • Word sense disambiguation (local disambiguation, global disambiguation); • The problem of automatic metaphor detection 8. CONğINUTURI CONTENT 8.1. Curs Course Metode de predare Teaching methods ObservaĠii Remarks Introducere: tipuri de aplicaĠii ale domeniului; nivelurile la care se realizează prelucrarea automată a limbajului natural; exemple de dificultăĠi care apar în prelucrare: ambiguitatea lexicală, structurală, semantică Introduction: types of applications; the levels of natural language processing; difficulties typical of natural language processing; the ambiguity problem: lexical, structural and semantic ambiguity Prezentarea bazată pe slide-uri Explica܊ia Descrierea ܈i exemplificarea Presentation based on slides Explanation Description and exemplification Procesare la nivel morfologic (etichetarea cu părĠi de vorbire): ce este un POS-tagger, cum lucrează, exemple consacrate de POS-taggers

--- Pagina 44 ---
56 Processing at the morphological level (part of speech tagging): what a POS-tagger is, how it works, examples of successful POS-taggers Procesare la nivel sintactic: gramatici de dependenĠă; structura de dependenĠă a unei propoziĠii; analiza sintactică de dependentă; Stanford parser Processing at the syntactic level: dependency grammars, the dependency structure of a sentence; dependency syntactical analysis; Stanford parser Reprezentarea cunoştinĠelor despre limbajul natural prin intermediul: 1. o reĠea semantică (WordNet); 2. o reprezentare vectorială (Word embeddings ) Knowledge representation for natural language by means of: 1. a semantic network (WordNet); 2. a vector representation (Word embeddings) Procesare la nivel semantic: dezambiguizarea automată a sensului cuvintelor (supervizată, bazată pe cunoştinĠe, nesupervizată) Processing at the semantic level: word sense disambiguation (supervised, knowledge-based, unsupervised) Detectarea automată a metaforei (achiziĠia de cunoştinĠe, abordări statistice) Automatic metaphor detection (knowledge acquisition, statistical approaches) Bibliografie/ Bibliography: D. Jurafsky, J.H. Martin, Speech and Language Processing: An Introduction to Natural Language Processing, Computational Linguistics and Speech Recognition, 2nd ed., Pearson, 2009. C. D. Manning, H. Schutze, Foundations of Statistical Natural Language Processing, The MIT Press, 1999. F. Hristea, The Naïve Bayes Model for Unsupervised Word Sense Disambiguation. SCURTĂ DESCRIERE* BRIEF DESCRIPTION* * COROBORAREA CONğINUTURILOR DISCIPLINEI CU AŞTEPTĂRILE REPREZENTANğILOR COMUNITĂğII EPISTEMICE, ASOCIAğIILOR PROFESIONALE ŞI ANGAJATORI REPREZENTATIVI DIN DOMENIUL AFERENT PROGRAMULUI / CORRELATION BETWEEN THE CONTENT OF THE COURSE AND THE NEEDS/EXPECTATIONS OF THE EPISTEMIC COMMUNITY, PROFESSIONAL ASSOCIATION S AND/OR SIGNIFICANT EMPLOYERS RELEVANT FOR THE PROGRAM No܊iunile introduse în acest curs vor dezvolta capacitatea de analiză ܈i de sinteză a studen܊ilor, contribuind astfel la formarea abilită܊ilor de cercetare ܈i inovare ale acestora. Ele vor conduce la o mai bună ܈i profundă în܊elegere a problemelor legate de procesarea limbajului natural, dezvoltând capacitatea de a concepe ܈i implementa sisteme ܈i tehnologii pentru limbajul uman ܈i pregătind astfel cursanĠii pentru piaĠa muncii. Oferind acces la dezvoltări ܈i tendinĠe actuale – teoretice ܈i practice – cursul pregăte܈te candida܊i care pot urma programe doctorale ܈i care pot deveni membri ai departamentelor de cercetare ale firmelor din domeniu. The concepts brought in by this course will develop student capabilities of analysis and synthesis, thus contributing to the formation of their research and innovation abilities. They will lead to a better and more profound understanding of natural language processing issues, while developing the capacity to conceive and to implement human language systems and technologies, thus preparing the students for the labor market. The course gives access to current trends in the field, of both theoretical and practical nature. It prepares students for future doctoral programs, but also for becoming members of the research departments of companies in the field. 10. EVALUARE

OBIECTIVELE DISCIPLINEI COURSE GOAL & OBJECTIVES 7.1 Obiectivul general al disciplinei Course goal În cadrul acestei discipline studen܊ii vor putea opta între dezvoltarea unei aplica܊ii practice ܈i realizarea unei cercetări teoretice. Obiectivul disciplinei este de a dezvolta capacitatea de muncă independentă, capacitatea de comunicare a rezultateor ob܊inute, de analizare a metodelor ܈i instrumentelor specifice, de orientare în vederea dezvoltării profesionale ulterioare. Within this discipline, students will be able to choose between developing a practical application and conducting a theoretical research. The objective of the discipline is to develop independent work capacity, the ability to communicate the obtained results, to analyze the specific methods and instruments, and to guide

--- Pagina 49 ---
61 them for further professional development. 7.2 Obiective specifice Course objectives Studen܊ii cu aptitudini aplicative vor realiza un proiect, individual sau în echipă. Studen܊ii cu aptitudini teoretice vor citi ܈i prezenta articole de cercetare ܈i vor realiza un raport ܈tiin܊ific. Students with applied skills will develop a project, individually or in a team. Students with theoretical skills will read and present research articles and will produce a scientific report. 8. CONğINUTURI CONTENT 8.1. PRECONDIğII PRECONDITIONS 4.1 De curriculum Curriculum-related Cursurile: Învă܊are automată aplicată, Învă܊are automată, Vedere artificială, Procesarea limbajului natural 1 Courses: Practical Machine Learning, Advanced Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing I 4.2 De competenĠe Skills-related • Cunoa܈terea conceptelor de bază despre limbajul python ܈i lucrul cu librăriile numpy, scikit-learn. • Capacitatea de abordare principială a problemelor practice din domeniu învă܊ării automate. Cunoa܈terea conceptelor de bază ܈i a paradigmelor de învă܊are automată. • Cunoa܈terea principalelor metode de clasificare supervizată ܈i nesupervizată. • Cunoa܈terea principiilor de evaluare pentru utilizarea corectă ܈i eficientă a metodelor de clasificare. • Know the basic concepts about python and working with numpy and scikit- learn. • Have the ability to tackle practical machine learning problems based on correct principles. • Know the basic concepts and the paradigms of machine learning. • Know the main supervised and unsupervised classification methods. • Know the evaluation principles for the correct and efficient utilization of classification methods. 5. CONDIğII CONDITIONS 5.1 De desfăşurare a cursului For running the course Cursul se va desfă܈ura într-o sală cu calculator ܈i videoproiector. The lecture will be held in a room with a computer and a videoprojector. 5.2 De desfăşurare a seminarului For running the seminar Seminarul se va desfă܈ura într-o sală de laborator dotată cu calculatoare ce au instalat python ܈i librăriile numpy, scikit-learn, caffe, pytorch, tensorflow. The seminar will be held in a laboratory room with computers, all which have python, numpy, scikit-learn, caffe, pytorch and tensorflow installed. 6. COMPETENğE SPECIFICE ACUMULATE ACQUIRED SKILLS 6.1 CompetenĠe profesionale Professional skills • Cunoa܈terea conceptelor pe care se bazează învă܊area automată de tip “deep”. • Studiul principalelor metode de clasificare de tip “deep”. • Studiul metodelor ܈i a practicilor utilizate în antrenarea modelelor de tip “deep”. • Antrenarea, testarea ܈i utilizarea metodelor studiate pentru rezolvarea problemelor practice. • Lucrul cu librăriile caffe, pytorch ܈i tensorflow din python. • Dezvoltarea capacită܊ii de abordare principială a problemelor practice din domeniu. • Learn the concepts that lay the foundation of deep learning. • Study the main deep learning methods. • Study the methods and the best practices in training deep models. • Train, test and utilize the studied methods to solve practical problems. • Learn the basic concepts on working with caffe, pytorch and tensorflow from python. • Develop the ability to tackle practical problems based correct principles.

66 6.2 CompetenĠe transversale Cross-cutting skills • Dezvoltarea gândirii critice; dezvoltarea capacităĠii de a citi, înĠelege ܈i prelucra materialele literaturii de specialitate, atât în limba română, cât ܈i în limba engleză. • Stimularea gândirii analitice ܈i sintetice; formarea abilităĠilor de cercetător. • Documentarea judicioasă pentru abordarea unor teme ܈i probleme concrete. • Capacitatea de a identifica, în܊elege, aplica ܈i dezvolta materiale corespunzătoare bibliografiei cursului, pentru referate ܈i proiecte. • Capacitatea de a redacta si prezenta referate ܈i proiecte. • Constituirea echipei de cercetare; organizarea activităĠilor de cercetare/proiectare în proiecte realizate în echipă. OBIECTIVELE DISCIPLINEI COURSE GOAL & OBJECTIVES 7.1 Obiectivul general al disciplinei Course goal • Familiarizarea studen܊ilor cu principalele tehnici de învă܊are “deep” ܈i utilizarea lor în rezolvarea problemelor practice. • Getting to know the main deep learning techniques and learning to use them to solve practical problems. 7.2 Obiective specifice Course objectives • În܊elegerea conceptelor care stau la baza metodelor de învă܊are “deep”. • În܊elegerea tipurilor de probleme care pot fi rezolvate cu metode de învă܊are de tip “deep”. • Dezvoltarea capacită܊ii de alegere ܈i utilizare corectă a metodelor de învă܊are “deep” în diferite probleme reale. • Understanding the main concepts behind the deep learning approach. • Understanding the type of problems that can be solved with deep learning methods. • Developing the capacity to make informed choices about the deep learning methods to be used in various practical problems. 8. CONğINUTURI CONTENT 8.1. Curs Course Metode de predare Teaching methods ObservaĠii Remarks 1. Concepte de bază ale re܊elelor neuronale. 1. Main concepts of artificial neural networks. Algoritmul coborârii pe gradient. 2. Loss function optimization. Gradient descent algorithm.

--- Pagina 55 ---
67 3. Re܊ele neuronale convolu܊ionale pentru imagini. 3. Convolutional neural networks for images. - computer - chalkboard 4. Re܊ele neuronale convolu܊ionale pentru documente text. 4. Convolutional neural networks for text. 5. Tehnici de îmbunătă܊ire a performan܊ei: regularizare, dropout, dense-sparse-dense, etc. 5. Techniques to improve performance: regularization, dropout, dense-spase-dense, etc. 6. Modele de auto-încodare. 6. Auto-encoders. 7. Re܊ele neuronale recurente. 7. Recurrent neural networks. 8. Re܊ele neuronale generativ-adversariale. 8. Generative adversarial networks. 9. Antrenarea nesupervizată a re܊elelor neuronale. 9. Unsupervised training of neural networks. Laborator [temele de laborator, proiecte etc, conform calendarului disciplinei] Laboratory [laboratory themes, projects, etc., according to the discipline calendar] Metode de predare- învăĠare Teaching and learning methods ObservaĠii Remarks 1. Recapitulare python, numpy ܈i scikit-learn. 2. Utilizarea func܊iilor din librăriile caffe, pytorch, tensorflow. 3. Rezolvarea unor problem practice (recunoa܈terea caracterelor optice, recunoa܈terea obiectelor în imagini, descrierea automată videoclipurilor, traducerea automata a textelor, etc.) utilizând practicile ܈i metodele de învă܊are “deep” predate la curs. 1. Recap of python, numpy and scikit-learn. 2. Use the functions defined in caffe, pytorch, tensorflow. 3. Solve practical problems (optical character recognition, object recognition in images, video captioning, machine translation, etc.) using the deep learning methods studied during the courses. Această activitate ajută la în܊elegerea tipurile de probleme care se pot aborda cu metode de învă܊are “deep” ܈i la modul de rezolvare al acestor probleme prin aplicarea conceptelor ܈i a celor mai bune practice prezentate la curs. This activity helps to students to understand the type of problems that can be solved with machine learning methods and how to solve such problems by applying the concepts and best practices studied during the courses. SCURTĂ DESCRIERE* BRIEF DESCRIPTION* * COROBORAREA CONğINUTURILOR DISCIPLINEI CU AŞTEPTĂRILE REPREZENTANğILOR COMUNITĂğII EPISTEMICE, ASOCIAğIILOR PROFESIONALE ŞI ANGAJATORI REPREZENTATIVI DIN DOMENIUL AFERENT PROGRAMULUI / CORRELATION BETWEEN THE CONTENT OF THE COURSE AND THE NEEDS/EXPECTATIONS OF THE EPISTEMIC COMMUNITY, PROFESSIONAL ASSOCIATION S AND/OR SIGNIFICANT EMPLOYERS RELEVANT FOR THE PROGRAM No܊iunile introduse în acest curs dezvoltă capacitatea de abordare a problemelor de învă܊are automată cu modele de învă܊are “deep” ܈i de aplicare a celor mai potrivite metode pentru rezolvarea acestor probleme. Cursul este în principal axat pe punerea în practică a no܊iunilor teoretice dintr-un subdomeniu de actualitate al inteligen܊ei artificiale, cel al învă܊ării “deep”. Cursul î܈i propune să dezvolte ܈i aptitudini de cercetare ܈i inovare, pregătind candida܊ii atât în vederea continuării studiilor cu un program doctoral cât ܈i în vederea angajării ca membri în departamentele de cercetare ale companiilor din domeniul informaticii. The concepts presented in this course are aimed at developing both the capacity to approach machine learning problems using deep learning methods and the ability to apply the best practices and choose the suitable method to solve these problems. The course is mainly focused on putting into practice the theoretical concepts of a recent field of artificial intelligence, namely deep learning. The course aims to develop the research and innovation abilities of the students, preparing them for both academia (they can pursue a doctoral program in the field) and industry (they can find employment in the R&D departments of computer science companies). 10. 72 principles and norms of research ethics and of professional ethics, in general 7. OBIECTIVELE DISCIPLINEI COURSE GOAL & OBJECTIVES 7.1 Obiectivul general al disciplinei Course goal • Introducerea în domeniul regăsirii informaĠiei şi analizei textului, întelegerea prcesului prin care un sistem poate răspunde întrebărilor utilizatorului cu informaĠii bazate pe text despre o anumită tematică şi alte caracteristici (autor, opinie, etc.) • Introduction to the domain of Information Retrieval and Text Mining, understanding of the process through which a computer system can respond to a user's query for text-based information on a specific topic and other aspects (author, opinion, etc.) 7.2 Obiective specifice Course objectives • ȊnĠelegerea arhitecturii unui sistem de regăsirea informaĠiei • Understanding of the architecture of an information retrieval system • Familiarizarea cu tehnicile utilizate în analiza textului • Getting acquainted with the techniques used in text mining 8. CONğINUTURI CONTENT 8.1. Curs Course Metode de predare Teaching methods ObservaĠii Remarks Structura unui sistem de regăsire a informaĠiei: structura de index, procesarea întrebărilor Boolene The structure of an IR system: inverted index, Processing Boolean queries Prezentarea bazată pe slide-uri Explica܊ia Descrierea ܈i exemplificarea Presentation based on slides Explanation Description and exemplification Vocabularul de termeni: segmentarea lexicală, eliminarea cuvintelor funcĠionale, lematizare Term vocabulary: tokenization, stop words removal, stemming and lemmatization Structura de index şi construcĠia acesteia: indecşi bigrami, indecşi poziĠionali, pointeri de salt Index and index construction: biword indexes, positional indexes, skip pointers. Regăsirea robustă: întrebări incomplet specificate, corectarea ortografică, corectarea fonetică Tolerant retrieval: wildcard queries, spelling correction, phonetic correction Modelul vectorial: ponderarea tf-idf Vector space model: tf-idf weighting Evaluarea sistemelor de regăsire a informaĠiei Evaluation in information retrieval Căutare web şi analiza legăturilor Web search and link analysis Tipuri de probleme în analiza textului Landscape of text mining tasks Categorizarea textelor Text Categorization Analiza şi modelarea tematicii Topic Analysis and Topic Modeling Analiza opiniei şi a sentimentului Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis Identificarea limbii native Native Language Identification Bibliografie/ Bibliography: Cheng Xiang Zhai, Sean Massung, Text Data Management and Analysis: A Practical Introduction to Information Retrieval and Text Mining, ACM Books, Morgan & Claypool, 2016 Christopher D. Manning, Prabhakar Raghavan, Hinrich Schütze, Introduction to Information Retrieval, Cambridge University Press. 2008.

Obiectivele cursului sunt acelea de înĠelegere a prcesului prin care un sistem poate răspunde întrebărilor utilizatorului cu informaĠii bazate pe text despre o anumită tematică şi alte caracteristici (autor, opinie, etc.), pregătind astfel cursanĠii pentru piaĠa muncii. Oferind deasemenea acces la dezvoltări ܈i tendinĠe actuale – teoretice ܈i practice – cursul pregăte܈te candida܊i care pot urma programe doctorale ܈i care pot deveni membri ai departamentelor de cercetare ale firmelor din domeniu. The concepts brought in by this course will develop student capabilities of analysis and synthesis, thus contributing to the formation of their research and innovation abilities. Information Retrieval and Text Mining are very active areas of

--- Pagina 62 ---
74 Artificial Intelligence. The course objectives are the understanding of the process through which a computer system can respond to a user's query for text-based information on a specific topic and other aspects (author, opinion, etc.), thus preparing the students for the labor market. The course also gives access to current trends in the field, of both theoretical and practical nature. It prepares students for future doctoral programs, but also for becoming members of the research departments of companies in the field. 10. COMPETENğE SPECIFICE ACUMULATE ACQUIRED SKILLS 6.1 CompetenĠe profesionale Professional skills • Capacitatea de a utiliza instrumente de procesare specifice, pentru analiza fenomenelor si aspectelor limbajului natural la diverse niveluri (fonetic, morfologic, syntactic) • Dezvoltarea abilitatii de a proiecta sisteme capabile de analiza si interpretare automata a textelor • Cunoasterea unor elemente de baza si avansate din domeniul procesarii automate a limbajului natural • Aplicarea tehnicilor formale si de invatare automata in probleme de procesare a limbajului natural. • the capacity to use computational tools to analyze and investigate specific natural language aspects, at various levels (phonetic, morphologic and syntactic); • developing the ability to design artificial systems capable of automated analysis and interpretation of texts • acquiring basic and advanced knowledge in natural language processing domain • applying formal and machine learning techniques in natural language processing problems 6.2 CompetenĠe transversale Cross-cutting skills • Utilizarea eficientă a surselor informaĠionale şi a resurselor de comunicare şi formare profesională. • Capacitatea de a citi si prelucra materiale profesionale in limbi de circulatie internationala • Capacitate de a redacta si prezenta proiecte • Desfăşurarea eficientă ܈i eficace a activităĠilor organizate în echipă. • Utilizarea instrumentelor si metodelor informatice în context interdisciplinar. • Efficient management of the information sources and other professional training resources • The ability to read and process professional resources in universal languages (such as English) • Developing skills for preparing and presenting projects

--- Pagina 66 ---
78 • Developing teamwork abilities • Using IT tools and methods in interdisciplinary paradigms 7. OBIECTIVELE DISCIPLINEI COURSE GOAL & OBJECTIVES 7.1 Obiectivul general al disciplinei Course goal • Familiarizarea studentilor cu directii fundamentale si moderne din domeniul prelucrării limbajului natural, prin intermediul aplicaĠiilor si uneltelor concrete • Studentii isi vor dezvolta capacitatea de a modela si analiza probleme de procesare a limbajului natural, de a citi si prezenta articole stiintifice, de a lucra in echipa si vor fi stimulati sa aduca contributii originale. • Getting acquainted with fundamental and modern directions in the field of natural language processing, through concrete applications and tools • The students will develop the ability to model and analyze natural language processing problems, to read and present scientific articles, to work in a team, and will be stimulated to make original contributions. 7.2 Obiective specifice Course objectives La sfarsitul cursului, studentii vor avea cunostinte teoretice si abilitati practice necesare pentru tratarea aspectelor formale si cantitative ale procesarii limbajului natural. Vor putea utiliza tehnici de invatare automata in domeniul limbajului natural. Vor fi capabili sa analizeze probleme de fonologie si morfologie, probleme de similaritate a limbajului natural, de rezumare automata, identificare de autor al unor texte cu paternitate incerta, analizare de resurse. Cursul este flexibil, adaptandu-se nevoilor pietii muncii si cercetarii si dezvoltarii din domeniu. At the end of this course, the students will possess theoretical knowledge and practical abilities to treat formal and quantitative aspects of natural language processing. They will be able to use machine learning techniques for natural language processing. Also, they will develop the ability to analyze phonology and morphology aspects, natural language similarity problems, summarization, authorship identification, resources analysis. The course is flexible, adaptable to the new research developments and labour market requirements in the domain. 8. CONğINUTURI CONTENT 8.1. Curs Course Metode de predare Teaching methods ObservaĠii Remarks 1. Electronic resources and corpus analysis Resurse electronice si analiza de corpus Prezentarea bazată pe slide-uri Explica܊ia Descrierea ܈i exemplificarea Slides presentations Explanation Description and exemplification 2. Quantitative and cognitive aspects of natural language. Aspecte cantitative si cognitive ale limbajului natural 3. Computational morphology and phonology 4. Fonologie si Morfologie computationala 5. Linguistic distances Distante aplicate in procesarea limbajului natural 6. Similarity problems of natural language Probleme de similaritate ale limbajului natural 7. Authorship identification and intelligent text processing Identificarea autorului unor texte cu paternitate incerta si analiza textelor

--- Pagina 67 ---
79 8. Text summarization Rezumare automata 9. Collocation detection and named-entity recognition Detectarea colocatiilor si recunoasterea entitatilor 10. SCURTĂ DESCRIERE* BRIEF DESCRIPTION* * COROBORAREA CONğINUTURILOR DISCIPLINEI CU AŞTEPTĂRILE REPREZENTANğILOR COMUNITĂğII EPISTEMICE, ASOCIAğIILOR PROFESIONALE ŞI ANGAJATORI REPREZENTATIVI DIN DOMENIUL AFERENT PROGRAMULUI / CORRELATION BETWEEN THE CONTENT OF THE COURSE AND THE NEEDS/EXPECTATIONS OF THE EPISTEMIC COMMUNITY, PROFESSIONAL ASSOCIATION S AND/OR SIGNIFICANT EMPLOYERS RELEVANT FOR THE PROGRAM No܊iunile introduse în acest curs vor dezvolta capacitatea de analiză ܈i de sinteză a studen܊ilor, contribuind astfel la formarea abilită܊ilor de cercetare ܈i inovare ale acestora. Ele vor conduce la o mai bună ܈i profundă în܊elegere a problemelor legate de procesarea limbajului natural, dezvoltând capacitatea de a concepe ܈i implementa sisteme ܈i tehnologii pentru limbajul uman ܈i pregătind astfel cursanĠii pentru piaĠa muncii. Oferind acces la dezvoltări ܈i tendinĠe actuale – teoretice ܈i practice – cursul pregăte܈te candida܊i care pot urma programe doctorale ܈i care pot deveni membri ai departamentelor de cercetare ale firmelor din domeniu. The concepts brought in by this course will develop student capabilities of analysis and synthesis, thus contributing to the formation of their research and innovation abilities. They will lead to a better and more profound understanding of natural language processing issues, while developing the capacity to conceive and to implement human language systems and technologies, thus preparing the students for the labor market. The course gives access to current trends in the field, of both theoretical and practical nature. It prepares students for future doctoral programs, but also for becoming members of the research departments of companies in the field. 10. OBIECTIVELE DISCIPLINEI COURSE GOAL & OBJECTIVES 7.1 Obiectivul general al disciplinei Course goal În cadrul acestei discipline studen܊ii vor putea opta între dezvoltarea unei aplica܊ii practice ܈i realizarea unei cercetări teoretice. Obiectivul disciplinei este de a dezvolta capacitatea de muncă independentă, capacitatea de comunicare a rezultateor ob܊inute, de analizare a metodelor ܈i instrumentelor specifice, de orientare în vederea dezvoltării profesionale ulterioare. During this class students can choose between working towards a practical

--- Pagina 72 ---
84 application or conducting research. The aim of the class is to develop students’ ability to work independently, to communicate results, to analyze specific methods and tools, to discover a direction for further professional development. 7.2 Obiective specifice Course objectives • Studen܊ii cu aptitudini aplicative vor începe realizarea unui proiect individual. • Studen܊ii cu aptitudini teoretice î܈i vor alege un subiect teoretic, vor citi articole relevante pentru acest subiect ܈i vor ܊ine prezentări în cadrul seminariilor de cercetare. • Industry inclined students will begin the development of an individual project. • Research inclined students will choose a research subject, will read research papers relevant to that subject, and will present their findings at research seminars. 8. Proiect [doar pentru disciplinele la care exista proiect semestrial normat in planul de invatamant] Project [only for disciplines that have a project in the curriculum] Metode de predare- învăĠare Teaching and learning methods ObservaĠii Remarks În cadrul acestei discipline studen܊ii vor putea alege între o dezvoltare teoretică ܈i una aplicată. Toate proiectele vor fi individuale. Diferen܊iem: - proiecte practice – studen܊ii vor trebui să realizeze o aplica܊ie, urmând ca ulterior să realizeze ܈i documenta܊ia acestei aplica܊ii; - proiecte teoretice – ܈tuden܊ii î܈i vor alege un subiect teoretic ܈i vor începe investigarea acestuia sub îndrumarea profesorului coordonator; vor face prezentări în cadrul seminariilor ܈i vor putea începe redactarea tezei de diserta܊ie. În separarea de mai sus ܊inem cont de caracterul predominant a activită܊ii, dar se dore܈te îmbinarea armonioasă a celor două abordări: proiectele aplicate pot con܊ine dezvoltări teoretice, iar temele teoretice pot fi înso܊ite de aplica܊ii practice. During this class students can choose to pursue either a research-oriented, or an industry-oriented development. Teme sau proiecte indivudale. Individual assignments and projects

--- Pagina 73 ---
85 All projects will be individual. We distinguish: - industry-oriented projects – students will begin developing and documenting an application - research-oriented projects – students will choose a research subject and will begin investigating it with guidance from the supervising professor; they will present their progress and findings in research seminars and will begin writing their dissertation. The distinction made above considers the primary focus of the activity; however, it is desirable to obtain a synergy between the two approaches: industry-oriented projects can contain research developments, while research projects can be accompanied by applications. Bibliografie/ Bibliography: Bibliografie: bibliografia va fi individuala, stabilita de profesorii care vor superviza activitatea. Bibliography will be individual, agreed upon together with the supervising professors. 9. This activity is an integrant part of the process of dissertation development. 10. COMPETENğE SPECIFICE ACUMULATE ACQUIRED SKILLS 6.1 CompetenĠe profesionale Professional skills • Dezvoltarea abilită܊ilor de analizare ܈i găsire a solu܊iilor algoritmice pentru probleme din diferite domenii • Cunoa܈terea tehnicilor de căutare pentru rezolvarea problemelor • Utilizarea limbajului Python pentru rezolvarea unor probleme de inteligen܊ă artificială • The development of the analytical and algorithmic skills for solving problems from different fields • Kowledge of searching techniques for problem solving • The use of Python language for some Artificial Intelligence problems solving 6.2 CompetenĠe transversale Cross-cutting skills • Dezvoltarea gândirii critice; dezvoltarea capacităĠii de a citi, înĠelege ܈i prelucra materialele literaturii de specialitate, atât în limba română, cât ܈i în limba engleză. • Stimularea gândirii analitice ܈i sintetice; formarea abilităĠilor de cercetător. • Documentarea judicioasă pentru abordarea unor teme ܈i probleme concrete. • Capacitatea de a identifica, în܊elege, aplica ܈i dezvolta materiale corespunzătoare bibliografiei cursului, pentru referate ܈i proiecte. • Capacitatea de a redacta si prezenta referate ܈i proiecte. • Constituirea echipei de cercetare; organizarea activităĠilor de cercetare/proiectare în proiecte realizate în echipă. Desfăşurarea eficientă ܈i eficace a activităĠilor organizate în echipă. • Manifestarea unor atitudini responsabile faĠă de domeniul ştiinĠific, pentru valorificarea optimă şi creativă a propriului potenĠial în cercetare, cu respectarea principiilor şi a normelor de etică a cercetării şi de etică profesională, în general. • Development of critical thinking; development of the capacity to read, understand and process the information in the literature of the field, both in Romanian and in English. • Stimulation of analytic and synthetic thinking; formation of research abilities. • Judiciously acquiring the necessary documentation for approaching specific topics and problems. • Developing the capacity to identify, understand, apply and develop the appropriate course references for usage within papers and projects. • Developing the capacity to write and to present papers and projects. • Building the research team; organizing research/development activities within

89 team projects. OBIECTIVELE DISCIPLINEI COURSE GOAL & OBJECTIVES 7.1 Obiectivul general al disciplinei Course goal • Familiarizarea studen܊ilor cu tehnicile de căutare pentru rezolvarea diferitelor tipuri de probleme • Getting the students acquainted with searching techniques for solving different types of problems. 7.2 Obiective specifice Course objectives • Studiul strategiilor de căutare neinformată ܈i informată ܈i a algoritmilor de optimizare • Abordarea problemelor de căutare în medii competitive • The study of the uniformed and informed search strategies and of the optimization alghoritms • The approach of searching problems in adversarial environments 8. CONğINUTURI CONTENT 8.1. Curs Course Metode de predare Teaching methods ObservaĠii Remarks Sisteme de rezolvare a problemelor Problem-solving systems Expunere pe slide-uri, cu descrieri, explica܊ii, demonstra܊ii ܈i exemple Presentation on slides with descriptions, explanations and examples Strategii de căutare neinformată Uninformed search strategies Strategii de căutare informată (euristică): algoritmul A* Informed (Heuristic) search strategies: A* algorithm Algoritmi de căutare locală ܈i probleme de optimizare: algoritmi genetici, simulated annealing. Local search algorithms and optimization problems: genetic algorithms, simulated annealing Probleme de căutare în medii competitive Adversarial search Bibliografie/ Bibliography: 1. Exemple de altfel de subdomenii sunt „reinforcement learning”, sisteme de recomandare. • Getting the students acquainted with subdomains of Artificial Intelligence that are very new and very specific and have not been covered in other disciplines. Example of such subdomanis are reinforcement learning and recommendation systems. 7.2 Obiective specifice Course objectives • Studiul strategiilor de căutare neinformată ܈i informată ܈i a algoritmilor de optimizare • Abordarea problemelor de căutare în medii competitive • The study of the uniformed and informed search strategies and of the optimization alghoritms • The approach of searching problems in adversarial environments 8. COMPETENğE SPECIFICE ACUMULATE ACQUIRED SKILLS 6.1 CompetenĠe profesionale Professional skills • Capacitatea de a realiza ܈i documenta un proiect complex. • Capacitatea de a citi, analiza ܈i prezenta un articol ܈tiin܊ific. • Ability to develop and document a complex project • Ability to read, analyze and present a research paper. 6.2 CompetenĠe transversale Cross-cutting skills • Utilizarea eficientă a surselor informa܊ionale ܈i a resurselor de comunicare şi formare profesională. • Capacitatea de a citi si prelucra materiale profesionale • Capacitate de a redacta si prezenta proiecte • Desfăşurarea eficientă ܈i eficace a activităĠilor organizate în echipă. • Ability to efficiently use information sources and professional communication and development resources • Ability to read and analyze professional resources • Ability to write and present research projects • Ability to efficiently and effectively work as part of a team 7. OBIECTIVELE DISCIPLINEI COURSE GOAL & OBJECTIVES 7.1 Obiectivul general al disciplinei Course goal În cadrul acestei discipline studen܊ii vor putea opta între dezvoltarea unei aplica܊ii practice ܈i realizarea unei cercetări teoretice. Obiectivul disciplinei este de a dezvolta capacitatea de muncă independentă, capacitatea de comunicare a rezultateor ob܊inute, de analizare a metodelor ܈i instrumentelor specifice, de orientare în vederea dezvoltării profesionale ulterioare. During this class students can choose between working towards a practical application or conducting research. The aim of the class is to develop students’

--- Pagina 87 ---
99 ability to work independently, to communicate results, to analyze specific methods and tools, to discover a direction for further professional development. 7.2 Obiective specifice Course objectives • Studen܊ii cu aptitudini aplicative vor realiza un proiect individual. • Studen܊ii cu aptitudini teoretice î܈i vor alege un subiect teoretic, vor citi articole relevante pentru acest subiect ܈i vor ܊ine prezentări în cadrul seminariilor de cercetare. • Obiectivul major al acestei activitati este finalizarea lucrarii de dizertatie. • Industry inclined students will complete the development their chosen project. • Research inclined students will choose a research subject, will read research papers relevant to that subject, and will present their findings at research seminars. • The goal of this activity is the completion of the disertation 8. CONğINUTURI CONTENT 8.1. Curs Course Metode de predare Teaching methods ObservaĠii Remarks 8.2. Seminar [temele dezbătute în cadrul seminariilor] Metode de predare- învăĠare Teaching and learning methods ObservaĠii Remarks Bibliografie/ Bibliography: 8.3. Laborator [temele de laborator, proiecte etc, conform calendarului disciplinei] Laboratory [laboratory themes, projects, etc., according to the discipline calendar] Metode de predare- învăĠare Teaching and learning methods ObservaĠii Remarks 8.4. Proiect [doar pentru disciplinele la care exista proiect semestrial normat in planul de invatamant] Project [only for disciplines that have a project in the curriculum] Metode de predare- învăĠare Teaching and learning methods ObservaĠii Remarks În cadrul acestei discipline studen܊ii vor putea alege între o dezvoltare teoretică ܈i una aplicată. Toate proiectele vor fi individuale. Diferen܊iem: - proiecte practice – studen܊ii vor trebui să realizeze o aplica܊ie, urmând ca ulterior să realizeze ܈i documenta܊ia acestei aplica܊ii; - proiecte teoretice – ܈tuden܊ii î܈i vor alege un subiect teoretic ܈i vor începe investigarea acestuia sub îndrumarea profesorului coordonator; vor face prezentări în cadrul seminariilor ܈i vor putea începe redactarea tezei de diserta܊ie. În separarea de mai sus ܊inem cont de caracterul predominant a activită܊ii, dar se dore܈te îmbinarea armonioasă a celor două abordări: proiectele aplicate pot con܊ine dezvoltări teoretice, iar temele teoretice pot fi înso܊ite de aplica܊ii practice. During this class students can choose to pursue either a Teme sau proiecte indivudale. Individual assignments and projects

--- Pagina 88 ---
100 research-oriented, or an industry-oriented development. All projects will be individual. We distinguish: - industry-oriented projects – students will begin developing and documenting an application - research-oriented projects – students will choose a research subject and will begin investigating it with guidance from the supervising professor; they will present their progress and findings in research seminars and will begin writing their dissertation. The distinction made above considers the primary focus of the activity; however, it is desirable to obtain a synergy between the two approaches: industry-oriented projects can contain research developments, while research projects can be accompanied by applications. Bibliografie/ Bibliography: Bibliografie: bibliografia va fi individuala, stabilita de profesorii care vor superviza activitatea. Bibliography will be individual, agreed upon together with the supervising professors. 9. SCURTĂ DESCRIERE* BRIEF DESCRIPTION* * COROBORAREA CONğINUTURILOR DISCIPLINEI CU AŞTEPTĂRILE REPREZENTANğILOR COMUNITĂğII EPISTEMICE, ASOCIAğIILOR PROFESIONALE ŞI ANGAJATORI REPREZENTATIVI DIN DOMENIUL AFERENT PROGRAMULUI / CORRELATION BETWEEN THE CONTENT OF THE COURSE AND THE NEEDS/EXPECTATIONS OF THE EPISTEMIC COMMUNITY, PROFESSIONAL ASSOCIATION S AND/OR SIGNIFICANT EMPLOYERS RELEVANT FOR THE PROGRAM Această activitate face parte din pregătirea lucrării de diserta܊ie. This activity is an integrant part of the process of dissertation development. 10. Student will defend their dissertation in front of the dissertation committee. 100%

101 concepts ➢ clarity of writing and presentation ➢ the complexity of the application ➢ originality 10.6. 10.4 Standard minim de performanĠă: Nota finala 5 (cinci) Threshold for the acquisition of the ECTS credits: Final grade 5 (five) STUDENTS SHOULD BE AWARE OF THE DEPARTMENT’S POLICY OF ACADEMIC INTEGRITY: cheating, falsification, forgery, multiple submission, plagiarism, complicity and computer misuse will automatically trigger a failing grade for the respective course. According to the provisions of the Charter of the University of Bucharest, students found guilty of plagiarism can be expelled from the University without the right to appeal. --- Pagina 1 ---
FACULTATEA DE MATEMATICĂ ŞI INFORMATICĂ STR. ACADEMIEI NR.14, SECTOR 1, C.P. 010014, BUCUREȘTI, ROMÂNIA TEL: (4-021) 314 3508, FAX: (4-021) 315 6990, E-MAIL: secretariat@fmi.unibuc.ro CURRICULUM OF THE PROGRAM UNIVERSITY OF BUCHAREST FACULTY OF MATHEMATICS Master Study Domain: Mathematics Master Study Program: Advanced Studies in Mathematics Type of studies: full-time Duration of studies - 4 semesters / 120 ECTS The master program Advanced Studies in Mathematics is designed to provide better training for future teachers and mathematics researchers. As a consequence, the curriculum develops in the direction of ensuring good specialized training (through mathematical content courses) as well as training in the field of mathematical research. Total (from all years of study) conventional course hours and laboratory / seminar: 2116.4 conventional hours (1627.6 = 520 × 3.13 conventional course hours and 488.8 = 260 × 1.88 conventional hours seminar / laboratory). sem. 1 sem. 2 sem. 3 sem. 4 Total conventional hours % Hours from the curriculum Synthesis / Fundamental Disciplines course 5 - - - 219,1 14% seminar 3 - - - 78,96 In-depth / specialization disciplines course 5 10 - - 657,3 40% seminar 2 5 - - 184,24 Supplementary disciplines course - - 10 10 751,2 46% seminar - - 5 5 225,6 The ratio of the number of course hours and laboratory / seminar in all years of study: 260/520 = 0.5 Total number of credits: 120 credits Professional practices, documentation / training, laboratory experiences, etc. (form of organization, number of hours allocated, venue, etc.): Each student has 2 hours / week of research practice per semester in the curriculum. This will be done under the guidance of a teacher who will recommend scientific articles, chapters in monographs, etc. for study and debate. The study may take place in the library of the faculty or at the Institute of Mathematics, the Research Institute of the University of Bucharest, or in the form of internships in various specialized companies. Comments and clarifications on the curriculum a. Elective course specifications - To choose elective courses for the third and fourth semesters, each student presents a list of five options, selected from the list of optional courses related to these two semesters. - All the courses in the list are ordered in descending order of the number of options. - Optional courses to be taught in semesters 3 and 4 will be the top five in each ordered list, respectively. - The proposed courses are independent, so the students can chose any five of them.

--- Pagina 2 ---
FACULTATEA DE MATEMATICĂ ŞI INFORMATICĂ STR. ACADEMIEI NR.14, SECTOR 1, C.P. 010014, BUCUREȘTI, ROMÂNIA TEL: (4-021) 314 3508, FAX: (4-021) 315 6990, E-MAIL: secretariat@fmi.unibuc.ro - The list of optional courses to be offered to the students can be completed in future, in order to better respond to the training needs of the becoming teacher-researchers. b. Specifications on scientific research - elaboration of dissertation paper In the second year (semesters 3 and 4), there will be scientific seminars and tutorials with the aim of assisting the students in the elaboration and writing of the dissertation papers. Throughout the semester(s), the tutorial will address both aspects of the major stages of the research process (such as: selection of the research topic, review of the literature, etc.) as well as specific aspects of the presentation and editing of the paper. The tutorial will be sustained by all the scientific advisors of the dissertation papers. Staff list. The list includes: the name and surname of the teaching staff; didactic and scientific function; the institution to which the teacher is employed; scientific competences, proven by: graduated specialization, doctoral specialization, scientific papers published in the last 10 years. --- Pagina 9 ---
FACULTATEA DE MATEMATICĂ ŞI INFORMATICĂ STR. ACADEMIEI NR.14, SECTOR 1, C.P. 010014, BUCUREȘTI, ROMÂNIA TEL: (4-021) 314 3508, FAX: (4-021) 315 6990, E-MAIL: secretariat@fmi.unibuc.ro 2. Instrumental 1. Ability to use mathematical methods studied in various previous courses for solving specific problems. 2. Ability to classify representations of certain classes of rings. 3. Attitudinal 1. to develop an interest for the field; 2. to realize the importance of modules (=representations) in modern mathematics 3. to assume an ethical conduct in scientific research; 4. to optimally valorise one’s own potential in scientific activities. SYLLABUS Lecture: 1. Rings: basic concepts and constructions (subrings, ideals, quotient rings, direct products, Dedekind finite rings); examples of rings (endomorphism rings, finite and infinite matrix rings, free rings, monoidal rings, polynomial rings, Ore extensions, incidence rings); graded rings, filtrations on rings and the associated graded ring. 2. Modules: basic concepts and constructions (submodules, factor modules, isomorphism theorems, exact sequences); algebras over a commutative ring; bimodules; essential submodules; direct summands and indecomposable modules; direct products and direct sums; free modules and IBN rings; projective modules; injective modules, Baer’s lemma and Eckmann-Schopf’s Theorem; indecomposable decompositions of modules and Azumaya’s Theorem. 3. Special classes of rings and modules: semisimple modules, semisimple rings and Wedderburn-Artin’s Theorem; Noetherian (Artinian) rings and modules; Hilbert Basis Theorem; generalized triangular matrix rings; the Jacobson radical, semisimple rings and simple artinian rings; local rings; modules of finite length, the Jordan-Holder Theorem and the Krull-Schmidt Theorem. Tutorials : 1. Construction of several classes of rings. 2. Understanding whether certain modules are free (projective, injective). 3. Examples of indecomposable decompositions. 4. Examples of rings and modules with finiteness properties. Bibliography 1. J. Rotman, Advanced modern algebra. Graduate Studies în Mathematics, 114. American Mathematical Society, Providence, RI, 2010. 2. T. Y. Lam, Lectures on modules and rings, Graduate Texts în Math., Vol. 189, Springer Verlag, Berlin-Heidelberg-New York, 1998.

--- Pagina 10 ---
FACULTATEA DE MATEMATICĂ ŞI INFORMATICĂ STR. ACADEMIEI NR.14, SECTOR 1, C.P. 010014, BUCUREȘTI, ROMÂNIA TEL: (4-021) 314 3508, FAX: (4-021) 315 6990, E-MAIL: secretariat@fmi.unibuc.ro 3. Lam, T. Y. Exercises în modules and rings. Problem Books în Mathematics. Springer, New York, 2007. 4. C. Nastasescu, Inele. Module. Categorii, Editura Academiei, 1978. Written exam Minimal requirements for mark 5 ( 10 point scale) Requirements for mark 10 (10 point scale) Correct solutions to indicated subjects (for mark 5) in final exam Average results to periodic/continuous testing. Correct solutions to all subjects in final exam. Correct solutions to homework problems. Successful presentations of scientific reports. Good results to periodic/continuous testing. Date: Lecturer(s) signature(s): Prof. Sorin Dascalescu Prof. Gigel Militaru

Vladoiu Faculty Mathematics and Computer Science Total hours per semester in curriculum Department Mathematics Main domain (sciences, art, culture) Exact Sciences Domain of master program Mathematics Total C S L P Program name Advanced Studies in Mathematics 42 28 14 ** C-lecture, S-practicals/tutorials, L-laboratory practical activity, P-scientific project Prerequisites Required Algebra I, II; Recommended Estimated time (hours per semester) for the required individual study 1. --- Pagina 12 ---
FACULTATEA DE MATEMATICĂ ŞI INFORMATICĂ STR. ACADEMIEI NR.14, SECTOR 1, C.P. 010014, BUCUREȘTI, ROMÂNIA TEL: (4-021) 314 3508, FAX: (4-021) 315 6990, E-MAIL: secretariat@fmi.unibuc.ro Specific competences 1.Knowledge and understanding 1. Knowledge and understanding of the basic properties of rings and algebras, and their importance in mathematics. 2. Understanding fundamental techniques in commutative algebra. 2. Instrumental 3. Ability to use mathematical methods studied in various previous courses for solving specific problems. 4. Ability to classify representations of certain classes of rings. 3. Attitudinal 5. to develop an interest for the field; 6. to realize the importance of modules (=representations) in modern mathematics 7. to assume an ethical conduct in scientific research; 8. to optimally valorise one’s own potential in scientific activities. SYLLABUS Lecture : 4. Tensor product of modules, bimodules. Tensor products of modules over a commutative ring. Tensor products of algebras. The tensor algebra, the symmetric algebra and the exterior algebra of a module. 5. Monomial ideals and operations. Primary decomposition in Noetherian rings. Uniqueness theorem(s) for primary decomposition. Structure theorem of Artinian rings. 6. Integral extensions. Going Up and Going Down theorems. Krull dimension of a ring. 7. Noether normalization lemma. Hilbert’s Strong and Weak Nullstellensatz. Dimension theory for finitely generated K-algebras and finitely generated polynomial rings over noetherian rings. 8. Graded rings and modules. Hilbert function, Hilbert series and Hilbert polynomial. Hilbert-Serre’s theorem. 9. Filtrations. Artin-Rees lemma. The m-adic completion of a local ring. The Krull intersection theorem. 10. Krull’s Hauptidealsatz. Dimension theory for local noetherian rings. Krull-Chevalley-Samuel theorem. 11. Regular local rings. Equivalent characterizations. Tutorials : 5. Computation of certain tensor products. 6. Operations with monomial ideals. Primary decompositions of arbitrary monomial ideals. 7. Examples of integral extensions. Computation of Krull dimension for quotients of polynomial rings modulo monomial ideals. 8. Applications of Noether normalization lemma.

--- Pagina 13 ---
FACULTATEA DE MATEMATICĂ ŞI INFORMATICĂ STR. ACADEMIEI NR.14, SECTOR 1, C.P. 010014, BUCUREȘTI, ROMÂNIA TEL: (4-021) 314 3508, FAX: (4-021) 315 6990, E-MAIL: secretariat@fmi.unibuc.ro 9. Algorithm for computing the Hilbert series, function, polynomial and Krull dimension for quotient of a polynomial ring modulo monomial ideals. 10. Minimal (graded) free resolutions. Bibliography 5. FACULTATEA DE MATEMATICĂ ŞI INFORMATICĂ STR. ACADEMIEI NR.14, SECTOR 1, C.P. 010014, BUCUREȘTI, ROMÂNIA TEL: (4-021) 314 3508, FAX: (4-021) 315 6990, E-MAIL: secretariat@fmi.unibuc.ro Specific competences 1.Knowledge and understanding 1. Knowledge and understanding of the key concepts in analysis 2. The use of Fourier analysis techniques 2. Instrumental 1. Ability to use mathematical methods studied in various previous courses for solving specific problems. 2. Analytic tools are necessary in variety of fields 3. Attitudinal 1. to develop an interest for the field; 2. to realize the importance of analytic tools in modern mathematics 3. to assume an ethical conduct in scientific research; 4. to optimally valorise one’s own potential in scientific activities. SYLLABUS Lecture : o Lebesgue integration with respect to a Radon measure and L^p spaces o The Fundamental Theorem of Analysis for BV functions and extensions o Fourier series, convergence, properties o Inversion Theorem for Fourier Series o Convergence of Fourier series of integrals and derivatives o Kronecker’s Theorem (the densityand unifrom distribution of integer parts of n*z, for irrational z) o Applications of Fourier analysis to ordinary differential equations o Fourier transform on the real line o Applications to PDEs o Cesaro, Abel-Poisson convergence and Tauberian theorems o A proof of the prime number theorem using Fourier analysis o Extensions of Fourier analysis, selfadjoint operators, spectrum and representations of solutions to PDE o An introduction to Fourier analysis on groups Tutorials : o Computations of Riemann versus Lebegue and issues.

Knowledge and understanding of the interplay between algebra, geometry and topology. 4. Understanding algebraic invariants of topological spaces. 5. Ability to use algebraic tools in geometry problems. 2. Instrumental 5. Ability to use mathematical methods studied in various previous courses for solving specific problems. 6. Ability to decide classification problems in geometry by using algebraic tools. 3. Attitudinal 9. to develop an interest for the field; 10. to realize the importance of the field of algebraic topology in contemporary mathematics; 11. to assume an ethical conduct in scientific research; 12. to optimally valorise one’s own potential in scientific activities. The exact sequence of the pair. 18. Excision. The Mayer Vietoris sequence. 19. Classification of surfaces. 20. Review of differential forms on manifolds. 21. De Rham cohomology. 22. Kuenneth formula for products and bundles. 23. Poincaré duality. 24. Introduction to sheaves and de Rham theorem (sketch of proof). Tutorials : 11. Commutativity of the foundamental group of Lie groups. 12. Explicit computations of fundamental group for various topological spaces. 13. Explicit computations of integral homology using simplicial decompositions. 14. Homology of spheres and applications (Brouwer, Borsuk-Ulam etc.) 15. Explicit computations of homology groups using Mayer-Vietoris sequence. 16. Explicit examples of integration on manifolds, use of Stokes theorem. 17. Vector bundles, homotopy invariance of pull-back. 18. Explicit computations of de Rham cohomology using Mayer- Vietoris sequence.

Ability to analyse and communicate mathematical methods and models. 11. To seek new sources of mathematical knowledge. 12. Rings of small dimension Tutorials : 25. Explicit computations of (co)homology groups. 26. Explicit computations of Tor and Ext for various modules. 27. Computation of projective and injective dimension of various modules. 28. Applications of group (co)homology and Hochschild (co)homology. N.B. --- Pagina 29 ---
FACULTATEA DE MATEMATICĂ ŞI INFORMATICĂ STR. ACADEMIEI NR.14, SECTOR 1, C.P. 010014, BUCUREȘTI, ROMÂNIA TEL: (4-021) 314 3508, FAX: (4-021) 315 6990, E-MAIL: secretariat@fmi.unibuc.ro Specific competences 1.Knowledge and understanding 9. Understanding the main concepts and notions of algebraic geometry. 10. Ability to recognize properties of given algebraic varieties (irreducibility, dimension, smoothness etc). 11. Knowledge and understanding of the interplay between algebra and geometry. 2. Instrumental 13. Ability to use mathematical methods studied in various previous courses for solving specific problems. 3. Attitudinal 21. to develop an interest for the field; 22. to realize the importance of the field of algebraic geometry and its central role in contemporary mathematics 23. to assume an ethical conduct in scientific research; 24. to optimally valorise one’s own potential in scientific activities. SYLLABUS Lectures : 1. Spaces with functions, definitions, elementary properties and examples from various fields (topology, differential geometry, algebra). 2. Morphisms of spaces with functions, products, separated spaces with functions, tangent spaces. 3. Affine varieties, Zariski topology, the correspondence between ideals and varieties. 4. Regular functions, coordinate rings, description of the morphisms between affine varieties, the identification theorem of affine varieties. 5. Abstract algebraic varieties. 6. Affine morphisms and finite morphisms, the geometric interpretation of the Noether normalization Lemma. 7. The dimension theory for algebraic varieties, the geometric interpretation of Krull’s principal ideal, the algebraic interpretation of the dimension. 8. The dimensions of the fibres of a morphism and applications. 9. Differentials and tangent vectors, smooth and singular points. 10. Etale morphisms. 11. Projective varieties, Zariski topology, the zeroes theorem and the correspondence between projective varieties and homogeneous ideals. 12. Homogenization and de-homogenization, projective varieties as algebraic varieties, homogeneous coordinate rings. 13. Examples of projective varieties: finite sets of points and their equations, Veronese varieties, Segre varieties, blow-ups in a point, Grassmannians.

--- Pagina 30 ---
FACULTATEA DE MATEMATICĂ ŞI INFORMATICĂ STR. ACADEMIEI NR.14, SECTOR 1, C.P. 010014, BUCUREȘTI, ROMÂNIA TEL: (4-021) 314 3508, FAX: (4-021) 315 6990, E-MAIL: secretariat@fmi.unibuc.ro 14. Complete varieties. Tutorials : 29. Examples of spaces with functions, verification of the definitions and properties. 30. Prove that some sets are affine varieties, and find their equations. 31. Examples of sets that are not affine varieties. 32. Images of morphisms, examples of images that are not varieties, determination of equations in some cases where images are affine varieties. 33. Decomposition of affine varieties into irreducible components; Description of specific coordinate rings. 34. Regularity of maps, determination of points where maps are regular and where they are not regular. 35. Determination of dimensions of various affine varieties. 36. Determination of singular and smooth points of specific varieties. 37. An irreducible algebraic variety is not a union of countably many proper closed subset; other more advanced exercises on abstract algebraic varieties. 38. Points in the projective space, understanding the difference between working with affine coordinates and homogeneous coordinates. 39. Homogenization and de-homogenizations of particular equations. 40. Determination of singular points of given projective varieties, verification of smoothness for projective varieties. 41. Projective transformations, identifying plane curves that are projectively equivalent. 42. Intersections in the projective plane. Bibliography - I. V. Dolgachev. Classical Algebraic Geometry: A Modern View. Cambridge Univ. Press 2012. - J. Harris. Algebraic Geometry: A first Course. Springer Graduate Texts in Math. 133, corrected edition 1995. - R. Hartshorne. Algebraic Geometry. Springer Graduate Texts in Math. 52, 8th corrected edition 1997. - G. R. Kempf. Algebraic Varieties. Cambridge University Press 1993. - D. Mumford. The Red Book of Varieties and Schemes. Springer Lecture Notes in Math. 1358, 2nd expanded edition 1999. - I. Shafarevich. Basic Algebraic Geometry I: Varieties in the Projective Space. Springer, 3rd edition 2013. Necessary scientific infrastructure Library

ACADEMIEI NR.14, SECTOR 1, C.P. 010014, BUCUREȘTI, ROMÂNIA TEL: (4-021) 314 3508, FAX: (4-021) 315 6990, E-MAIL: secretariat@fmi.unibuc.ro Specific competences 1.Knowledge and understanding - Knowledge and understanding of the interplay between groups, algebras and their representations. - Understanding the influence of the character tables on representation theory. - Ability to use group representation tools in solving problems in classical group theory. 2. Instrumental - Ability to use mathematical methods studied in various previous courses for solving specific algebra problems. - Ability to decide classification problems in group theory by using group representation theory tools. 3. Attitudinal - to develop an interest for the field; - to realize the importance of the field of group representation theory in contemporary mathematics - to assume an ethical conduct in scientific research; - to optimally valorise one’s own potential in scientific activities. SYLLABUS Lecture : 1. Group representations. 2. Irreducible modules. 3. Maschke’s theorem. 4. Irreducible characters. 5. Characters tables and orthogonality relations. 6. Some elementary character tables. 7. Permutations and characters. 8. Applications to group theory. 9. Burnside’s theorem. Tutorials : 1. Examples and constructions (representations, irreducible representations, characters, etc.) 2. Schur’s Lemma and applications. 3. Explicit computations of some character tables. 4. Algebraic integers. 5. Induced characters. N.B. The above is a description of the topics to be covered and are not in 1-1 correspondence with the 14 lectures/tutorials. Bibliography [M] C. Musili, Representations of Finite Groups, Texts and Readings in Mathematics, AMS, 2011. [GL] Gordon James, Martin Liebeck, Representations and Characters of Groups, Cambridge University Press, 2009..

ACADEMIEI NR.14, SECTOR 1, C.P. 010014, BUCUREȘTI, ROMÂNIA TEL: (4-021) 314 3508, FAX: (4-021) 315 6990, E-MAIL: secretariat@fmi.unibuc.ro Specific competences 1.Knowledge and understanding 12. Knowledge and understanding of the interplay between algebra, analysis, geometry and number theory. 13. Acquire the prerequisites for advanced courses in number theory. 14. Ability to use basic algebraic, analytical and geometrical tools in number theory problems. 2. Instrumental 14. Ability to use mathematical methods studied in various previous courses for solving specific number theory problems. 15. Ability to decide classification problems in number theory by using algebraic, analytical and geometrical tools. 3. Attitudinal 25. to develop an interest for the field; 26. to realize the importance of the field of number theory in contemporary mathematics 27. to assume an ethical conduct in scientific research; 28. to optimally valorise one’s own potential in scientific activities. SYLLABUS Lecture : 1. Formal series. Generating functions. 2. Characters. Dirichlet characters. Primitive characters. 3. Gauss sums. Finite Fourier analysis. 4. Vinogradov’s theorem on the least quadratic nonresidue. 5. Prime numbers in arithmetical sequences. Dirichlet’s theorem. 6. Lattices. Convex sets. 7. Geometry of numbers. Minkowski’s theorem of the convex body. 8. Sum of three sqauares. 9. Quadratic forms, genus theory. 10. Class numbers for quadratic forms of a given discriminant. Tutorials : B. Playing with formal series and generating functions. C. Connection between Legendre symbol and characters. D. Fourier coefficients of Dirichlet characters. E. Computing values of L-functions. F. How to use Dirichlet’s theorem in various problems. G. Applications of Minkowski’s theorem. H. Working with quadratic forms. N.B. The above is a description of the topics to be covered and are not in 1-1 correspondence with the 14 lectures/tutorials. Bibliography I. Heng Huat Chan, Analytic Number Theory for Undergraduates, World Scientific, 2009

ACADEMIEI NR.14, SECTOR 1, C.P. 010014, BUCUREȘTI, ROMÂNIA TEL: (4-021) 314 3508, FAX: (4-021) 315 6990, E-MAIL: secretariat@fmi.unibuc.ro Specific competences 2. Breef review of the notions and results studied in Complex Analysis I – the second year course in the License programm. 2. Cauchy-Pompeiu theorem. The d-bar equation for compactly supported functions. 3. Runge approximation theorem. Mittag-Leffler theorem. 4. The d-bar equation. Weierstrass theorem. 5. The Gamma Functiom. The zeta function. 6. Differential forms on Riemann surfaces. 10. The first cohomology groups with values in a sheaf. Leray's theorem. 11. Morphisms of sheaves. The cohomology sequence associated to a short exact sequence of sheaves. 12. Divisors and vector bundles on Riemann surfaces. 13. Finitness theorems for compact Riemann surfaces. 14. Riemann-Roch theorem. Tutorials : Examples and exercises related to the notions and results studied during the lectures. Student presentations of reports and small projects. Bibliography L.
